content.description:
Not one loose hold on this thing. Traverse a lip on a nice egg shaped boulder

Stand start with left hand on bomber under cling and right hand on the higher jug. Traverse on more jugs till you finish on pockets out right. Moving from the last jugs to the first pocket is the crux for me. Sustained climb
content.location: If your coming up the Prowler trail it’s in the ravine on your left.

content.description:
This boulder host as many SDS, dynos, and traverses as you can come up with. I stopped counting how many different variations there were on this little boulder.

This boulder is VERY close to the community so keep your trace to a minimum and be respectful of their property. We don't want to upset our neighbors so lets keep it clean!
content.location: Along the approach just after the Prowler trail. You'll see it right next to a wonderfully shady pepper tree.

content.description: A fun slab climb that compliments Prowler nicely. Start on the huge foot ledge at the bottom point of the slab. Mantle with your right foot in the dish. An awkward lay start on the large ledge left of the stand start is possible for a variation, as is pulling onto the slab from the start of Prowler. Good warmups!
content.protection: a pad for the sloping hillside

content.location:
After the red tractor go around the bend and then look up. There's a climber's trail next to the ravine that leads up to the obvious boulder up on the hillside. You pass

Early Retirement

and the awesome Karate Kid boulder in the ravine to get up there.  About 5 minutes from the Mystery Boulders. Some seriously fun lines and good rock.

content.description: Most right route on Wax on wax off boulder. To the right of Grasshoppa.  Sds on left pocket pinch thing and right on slopey pad and go straight up and mantle. Only a few moves but good movement
content.location:
The furthest right route on the Karate Kid boulder.

Same boulder as Wax On Wax Off

content.description:
Sit start to Grasshoppa. Start with left hand on undercling and right hand on the flake. Make big first move to starting jug on Grasshoppa. Use the jug and a good crimp to get to the jug on top. Start move is definitely the hardest part. Great hueco for your heel to start

Unsure about the grade. long reach but to a great hold. might be easier to get leverage if short.
content.location: under the Wax on Wax off boulder

content.description: Stand start with right hand on a huge jug in the middle of the boulder and left hand on an undercling. Go straight up.
content.location: Middle route on Wax on Wax off.

content.description: SDS on the two lowest pockets and climb straight up.
content.location: Before Wax on Wax off on the right. About 5 mins up off the trail.
